summary.intent: Expand the README Remediation section from a minimal ~25-line stub to a comprehensive ~45-line section covering the 4-phase AI pipeline, target agent formats, output types, remediation history, and impact evaluation.
summary.outcome: The README Remediation section was successfully expanded and committed to main (73bb7a0). All 1319 tests passed and lint was clean.

repo: Project uses bun as the runtime/package manager (bun run test, bun run lint)
Test suite has 1319 tests — changes to README do not affect test count
The 4 supported target agent formats are: AGENTS.md, Claude Code (CLAUDE.md), GitHub Copilot (.github/copilot-instructions.md), and Cursor (.cursor/rules/*.mdc)
Remediation pipeline is 4-phase: plan error fixes → execute error fixes → plan suggestions → execute suggestions
Output types are: Rule (declarative constraint, always loaded), Skill (procedural workflow, on-demand), Context update (direct edit to main file)

code.finding: Original Remediation section — 4 numbered steps, short output list, one-liner about prompt generation; expanded to ~45 lines covering pipeline, target agents table, output types, and history/impact evaluation

workflow: Per project rules, bun run test and bun run lint must be run even for documentation-only changes
Plan was authored in plan mode and stored in a .jsonl transcript file before implementation began
